intro: Sebaea pygmaea, commonly known as the dwarf sebaea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its small, showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun exposure. Its leaves are simple, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Sebaea pygmaea is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its compact size and attractive blooms.
